alert.note: Alert for New London (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 19 at 2:21AM EST until December 20 at 3:39AM EST by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Connecticut... ...Forecast flooding changed from Moderate to Minor severity for the following rivers in Connecticut... Yantic River near Yantic affecting New London County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Yantic River near Yantic. * WHEN...Until late tonight. * IMPACTS...At 9.5 feet, Flooding begins at several commercial structures along west Town Street in Yantic Flats. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:02 AM EST Tuesday the stage was 9.3 feet. - Bankfull stage is 8.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 2:02 AM EST Tuesday was 11.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage early this morning and continue falling to 3.9 feet Thursday evening. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.3 feet on 02/08/1941. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (1 am EST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Wed Thu Fri Yantic River Yantic 9.0 9.3 Tue 2 am EST 5.9 4.4 MSG &&
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 230 PM EST.
